sentence.text: Sgt Steve Atkinson said thieves walk in through unlocked back doors and snatch whatever they can .
Faces reddened at the Ministry of Defence when it was revealed that a thief had snatched top-secret documents about the Gulf from an unlocked car on December 17th .
A TIGER snatched a five-year-old girl from a van full of tourists after smashing a window with a paw and dragging her away by the head .
Jail chiefs have been told a prisoner snatched the keys from a warder who fell asleep on duty .
Impatiently , Jezrael pushed the canopy back and an icy blast of wind snatched it from her grasp .
She snatched it eagerly from his hand and began to eat with great relish .
She looked up into his face and resisted the urge to snatch the folder from his hand and strew its contents defiantly across the carpet .
She snatched Buster from his play and we went back into the house where she held him close to her face , laughing as the big cat purred and arched himself ecstatically against her cheek .
He snatched his furniture from the house and dumped it on a tip , then took the car which he had given her as a present away for scrap .
The man burst into the Alpine Cafe in Marine Drive , Southport , and vaulted over the counter to snatch £90 in cash .
Although Rangers could have snatched a point in the dying moments when Allen 's shot was blocked , an equalister would have been harsh .
An elderly churchgoer had her Bible stolen when a woman snatched her handbag in York 's Piccadilly on Sunday morning .
Even as her mother watched , a fourth man swooped from nowhere like a bird of prey and snatched the girl into his arms .
It fastened on Mala like a grasping hand and snatched her into the air .
` The attacker dragged her to the floor and snatched the bag off her arm .
She snatched her coat off the kitchen table and stormed out of the kitchen , shouting , ` And if by any chance I do need an escort , it wo n't be my bloody brother .
Keith tried to snatch the pen away from her and she slapped his hand so that he did not jog her .
Joyce raced down the road despite the crowds and snatched the child away from the would-be thief .
There was no need to barge in , in such a dramatic manner , and snatch it right out of my hand ! "
Tell me Mojo , when your kid got snatched by the aliens , was he wearing any brand-name designer-label clothing ? "
It is only with your help that the Czechoslovak Socialist Republic can be snatched away from the looming danger of counter-revolution . "
At the last moment his jewel had been snatched away .
Lord Haw-Haw would be snatched from the clutches of his armed bodyguard , dragged to the nearest convenient tree in Kensington Gardens , and strung up without ceremony .
It was snatched from her by a woman without heart or conscience , a woman driven by greed .
Jim and Pauline McGregor feared they would die after being snatched while holidaying in France .
The dealers snatch the baskets of produce they have bought and rush them to waiting lorries .
Magistrates used the in loco parentis provision of the Criminal Justice Act to impel the authority to compensate the 78-year-old woman who had her bag snatched by the youth .
Dealers have been alerted to look out for 250 items snatched from an exclusive house in London 's Belgravia .

South Londoner Thomas , 27 , was gunned down on his doorstep just days after the FBI were given information leading to the recovery of £290m worth of bond certificates , snatched from a messenger in the City .
He had obviously heard every word , and from the look of it was none too pleased to have a juicy story snatched from under his nose .
Irritated , she snatched out the earpiece and let the set dangle round her neck .
With that he snatched up the bottle and flung it through the open window into the yard .
Marek snatched up a bunch of grapes from the bedside table .
He snatched up his knapsack , not bothering in his haste to shrug it on .
Then as a waiter passed by bearing a laden tray , he reached out swiftly and snatched up a glass of champagne .
If Mola got there first , not only would he snatch that honour from him , but it might also mean the end of the war and his return to the relative anonymity of normal army routine .
His house was broken into , his fiancee was attacked while walking home and had her handbag snatched , and then his car window was smashed .
